title: Thingspeak access blocked on and off due to "security certificate" issues.
content: On a number of occasions over the years, I have been unable to log in to Thingspeak from my lap-top. Usually the problem goes away. This is stated as a problem with their security certificate. However, my tablet, also running Firefox (119.0.1) has no problem accessing my account. What is really the problem? I am running Windows 7 on my ancient lap-top (yes, I know it is way outdated, but I'm attached to it and rely on the security software I'm paying for) The tablet is running Android 8.1.0 and is my last resort for internet. Would really like to fix this.
creator: robertsk65

title: Links on some websites will not work in Firefox
content:
I would like to know why Firefox will not open links on certain websites. I am able to browse to these sites just fine. However, while navigating through said sites, sometimes links will not open. They do open in MS Edge and Google Chrome. One example is on the Kreg Tool website - https://www.kregtool.com/shop/workspace/bench-system-components/universal-bench-base-with-standard-height-legs/BENCH-BASE-STANDARD.html - I am not able to select the bench size from the drop down list. Firefox goes into a loop then I have to refresh to get out of the loop. Hopefully someone can explain this or provide a workaround.

Thanks much.

Dwane
creator: dwane37837

title: Extension Pins Not Syncing Across Devices â€“ Is This Normal?
content:
Hey everyone,

Just noticed that while my Firefox extensions sync across my devices, the pins for these extensions in the toolbar don't. I get my extensions, but I have to pin them every time I switch devices. Is this expected behavior, or is there a setting I'm missing somewhere? (And if it is - why?)

Thanks for any help!
creator: Stray6678

title: Cannot make Firefox work.  "Firefox is already running, but is not responding."
content:
I cannot get Firefox to work. It keeps saying ""Firefox is already running, but is not responding. The old Firefox process must be closed to open a new window." I've tried all the solutions I found by searching- forced to use the Edge browser. (https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/firefox-already-running-not-responding)

The Task manager does not show Firefox (or Mozilla) running. I've uninstalled Firefox several times, restarted my computer (Windows 10) each time. When I reinstall Firefox, I get the same message. 

 I can't use the troubleshooter because I can't open the program.

What else can I try? 

Thanks for any help!  (all my bookmarks, passwords, etc. are there).
creator: denaf1

title: Random Hang During Browsing - Hard Drive light On Solid
content:
Hello,

I tend to have a fair amount of windows and tabs open but this doesn't seem to have a noticed correlation. The symptoms are that FF will just go catatonic (spinning circle, Not Responding Header). When this happens the hard drive light is on solid. Eventually (10s of seconds to several minutes) FF will return to operation. Any idea of what is happening and how to fix this?
creator: Steve_Sr.
